_header: In the end of hiems when Phoebus had searched
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler TM 299.
Subjects: pageant verses; London, mayor of; colophons
_description: A pageant address to a London Lord mayor — four rhyme royal stanzas with a couplet heading: ‘By hym that all dothe embrase / And nothing his pleasure may compase’

CamTCC181.First Lines:
In the ende of yemps whan Phebus had serchidEnvyroun the world and
                    stode yn Aquarye…
CamTCC181.Last Lines:
…To yowre honowre worship and ryall magesteThat ȝe
                    persent duryng youre mayralte
CamTCC181.Attributed Title:
Vnto the most noble Senature with all diligens / Protector of the
                    comynwelte in oure absens (col., f. 172v)
